channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tesla ordered to stop releasing toxic emissions from San Francisco Bay Area plant after racking up 112 violations over the last 5 years
item.description: Each of the 112 violations can emit hundreds of pounds of illegal air pollution, the Bay Area Air Quality Management District board said.

item.title: Walgreens slashes profit guidance, citing 'challenging' environment for consumers and pharmacies
item.description: The results and guidance cut com as Walgreens works to slash costs by closing underperforming U.S. stores, among other measures.

item.title: H&M shares tumble as bad weather hits June sales
Even Americans making over $150,000 are cutting spending and worrying about making ends meet
item.description: When presented with seven points of concern by the Philly Fed, those earning $150,000+ were more worried than anyone else on the earnings spectrum, bar one point: transportation.

item.title: Thursday's analyst calls: Micron earnings reaction, oil giant gets an upgrade
item.description: A chipmaker and an oil giant from Brazil were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Thursday.

item.title: Will Biden and Trump need caffeine to debate? A look at the energy-drink market.
Inaccurate heat detectors, weak tanker walls, and a decision to needlessly blow open 5 chemical cars: NTSB hearing showcases what went wrong at Ohio derailment
item.description: The detectors railroads use along their tracks to help spot overheating bearings, flat wheels and dangling equipment were a key focus of the NTSB investigation.

item.title: France's upcoming election is rattling nerves and raising debt crisis talk
item.description: "In the worst case there is a fully-fledged bond market and fiscal crisis," one economist said.

item.title: Levi's sales miss expectations as jeans maker forecasts higher costs
Ask Andy: How much should startup founders pay themselves?
item.description: Bonobos and Pie founder Andy Dunn answers questions about founders' salaries, and about growing with a specific acquirer in mind.

item.title: Troops and armored vehicles disperse as Bolivia arrests army chief leading coup attempt
item.description: "The country is today facing an attempted coup d'etat," Bolivian President Luis Arce said, according to a CNBC translation

item.title: Amazon becomes only the fifth U.S. company to secure $2 trillion market cap
U.K. luxury watch market has stabilized but top Rolex seller issues profit warning due to lack of ‘gold and other precious metal watches’
item.description: Despite signs of stability, Watches of Switzerland warned that sales and profit would be weaker than anticipated.

item.title: China sets mid-July for highly anticipated ‘Third Plenum’ meeting to discuss 'deepening reform'
item.description: China's top leaders will gather from July 15 to 18 for a highly anticipated meeting known as the Third Plenum, state media announced Thursday.

item.title: Fed: Stress tests show banks 'well-positioned' to deal with 'severe' recession
